metadata.Title: CVE-2023-20937 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: In several functions of the Android Linux kernel, there is a possible way to corrupt memory due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-257443051References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: sbeattie> this is likely Android specific, as it's an issue with the interaction of CONFIG_SPECULATIVE_PAGE_FAULT, which never made it upstream (see lore link for thread).

criterions.comment: linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
